content:
Diagnosis:		Extensive stage small cell lung cancer, right hilar primary with liver and bone metastases

Management:		Cycle 1-4 Carboplatin/Etoposide completed March 2024
		Prophylactic cranial irradiation April 2024
		Cycle 1-2 second-line Topotecan May-June 2024

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 3 Topotecan

[redacted name] attended clinic today for review. Recent CT shows mixed response with reduction in liver metastases but new T8 vertebral lesion causing pain. Performance status remains 2. Managing current chemotherapy with grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 thrombocytopenia. Requires regular oxycodone for bone pain which has increased over past week. Blood results show platelets 89, hemoglobin 98, neutrophils 1.8 - acceptable for treatment continuation. Have arranged urgent MRI spine and referral to clinical oncology for consideration of palliative radiotherapy to T8. Will proceed with cycle 3 Topotecan today at current dose. Review in 2 weeks with blood results and after MRI.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows mixed response with reduction in liver metastases but new T8 vertebral lesion

patient_facts.value: Bone pain requiring regular oxycodone, increased over past week

status_updates.value: Extensive stage SCLC showing mixed response to second-line Topotecan with new symptomatic bone metastasis requiring urgent assessment
Continuing cycle 3 Topotecan at current dose
Clinical oncology referral for consideration of palliative radiotherapy to T8
